title: Leon (Souda Bay)
text:
Leon (, "lion"), also known colloquially as Nisi ("the island") and during <a href="Republic%20of%20Venice">Venetian</a> rule as Rabbit Island, is an islet in <a href="Souda%20Bay">Souda Bay</a> on the northwest coast of <a href="Crete">Crete</a>.
On the southeast side of the islet, a small distance away, there is another larger islet called <a href="Souda%20%28island%29">Souda</a>. In ancient times these two islets were referred to as Leukai (Greek for "white ones") and pronounced "Lefkai". Their name came from the ancient Greek myth about a musical contest between the <a href="Siren%20%28mythology%29">Siren</a>s and the <a href="Muses">Muses</a>. Out of their anguish from losing the competition, writes <a href="Stephanus%20of%20Byzantium">Stephanus of Byzantium</a>, the Muses plucked their rivals' feathers from their wings; the Sirens turned white and fell into the sea at <a href="Aptera%2C%20Greece">Aptera</a> ("featherless") where they formed the islands in the bay that were called Lefkai.
